Reviews.Title: Surpasses my expectations,but  read my update before buying!
Reviews.Author: serenic
Reviews.Content: This set replace a 27" CRT TV which broke down.I found the set-up easy, although I had to call Vizio tech support twice during the process to walk me through the settings. They were quick to respond and politely and expeditiously walked me through in clear English (they are located in the U.S.A)I was initially satisfied with the video, but found the audio to be tinny and annoying.At the time of order through Amazon, I also ordered the low priced HDMI cables and Square Trade 3 year warranty for $ 29. Two days later, my cable guy replaced my TV box with an HD box using a more substantial HDMI cable than what I ordered. I was flabbergasted with the result. The video filled the screen with a picture of photographic clarity and the sound quality is such, that I shelved my plan to use external speakers. I couldn't be happier with the end product.I returned the cables to Amazon using their prepaid shipping label (the shipping charge was equal to the price of the cables. I swear by Amazon and would not think of making a purchase without the feedback of their reviews.While I made my purchase based on all the favorable reviews and the promise of tech support for the life of the TV, I have a bit of trepidation after reading many complaints concerning their service. My cable guy assures me that they had a lot of trouble with their sets until two years ago and stated he now considers their TVs to be of high quality with lowest prices.Update: I remain very pleased with the quality of the video and audio.Following are the picture settings I have adjusted, which you might find helpful.they apply to a movie picture setting using Cablevision with a TV box with HDM1 cable.backlight ... 66brightness .. 52contrast .... 49color ....... 45tint ........  0sharpness ...  4UPDATE#2 (April 7,2013): After owning this set for two months, I am still amazed at the quality of the video and audio. There are,however,some occurrences which may benefit you through my recent experience which may be food for thought. Before I go further,be aware that like many other seniors in my age group, I  have little understanding of the technical jargon and comprehension of today's communication devices that go beyond the science of conversation with the aid of two dixie cups and string.Shortly after Cablevision installed an HD box and HDMI cable which brought out the picture and sound quality that pleased me, I noticed a lipsync problem that became manifest on several cable channels(the sound lagged behind the picture with progressive gapping to two or three second after an hour's viewing.)Cablevision made four attempts to correct the problem, changing the HD boxes three times and the HDMI once without any success.I contacted Vizio support and was told to change the PMC setting on the HD box. Cablevision stated there is no PMC setting on the boxes used and they didn't know what a PMC refers to. Finally, Vizio suggested doing away with the HDMI cable and use three single cables in its place and I will get the same reception quality that the HDMI cable provides. This was done by cablevision and the video and audio became synchronized. It was explained to me that an HDMI cable is composed of three cables in one.While I now enjoy watching talking heads without words trailing their sealed lips, I must pull out wires and plug in the jacks of my DVD in their place since it does not have an HDMI connection. This is somewhat of a nuisance, but I rarely use my DVD and it is not much of an effort, less so than having to return the set to Vizio and be further aggravated.I must add that Vizio responded to my e-mails within minutes or hours and were quick to respond to telephone calls. They are headquartered in South Dakota and speak in good old Americanese. Also Cablevision was very responsive and courteous in their attempts to correct the problem.The question remains as to whether my problem is limited to only my set or is it prevalent to this model? What HD boxes are compatible with this set?I mention the above to save you the aggravation I experienced the past six weeks of multiple calls and tech visits.If you want to discuss this problem, feel free to forward your comments.P.S. I changed the menu settings above from what I previously listed, increasing the picture quality.UPDATE #3i HAVE OWNED THIS SET 7 MONTHS AND REMAIN JUST AS PLEASED AS STATED IN PRIOR REVIEWS. I HAVE RATED 5 STARS FROM 4 AFTER HAVING MORE CONFIDENCE WITH TIME. I AM ESPECIALLY DELIGHTED WITH THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE WHICH IS HANDLED IN A VERY CAPABLE, PROFESSIONAL AND POLITE MANNER, WITH NO ENGLISH SPEAKING BARRIERS.

Reviews.Title: What I consider to be a budget friendly LCD TV.
Reviews.Author: Thomas (Sherri's husband)
Reviews.Content: First things first, as most might already know, there's a sibling to this Vizio offering, an E420D-A0.  The "D" is for 3-D.  The 3-D model also has Wi-Fi capability and a 120Hz refresh rate.  We chose the 2-D model.I've had the unit setup for an afternoon and have put in about four hours of viewing; "Cowboys and Aliens" was the main movie watched and several newscasts.  I have not watched any sporting events such as tennis or hockey so I can't say how well the television handles fast moving, small objects like a hockey puck or a tennis ball.  If I come across any niggles that a consumer should know about, I'll comeback and post follow-ups and if no follow-ups, then everything is performing as one would expect.The unit was easy to set up.  A very simple auto-setup came up when first turned on; language and the user was ask if they wanted to do a cable based, auto-channel select routine.  Other than that, if like us, using a HD cable box, I set the appliance to accept the HDMI input from the cable box and everything came right up.  I programmed the cable box remote and after entering the fifth number choice on the list, the cable box remote now operates both the cable box and the television.The unboxing was a normal event.  The only assembly was attaching the base to the already attached base neck, attached to the television with three hex head screws and the provided allen wrench.The out of the box colors, are set to factory specifications and I found them to be excellent.  There was a minor tweaking with contrast to improve movie shadow detail in nighttime movie scenes.  Other than that, everything is good to go, right out of the box.At this point, there's not much to add.The unit comes with a quick start manual and that's it.  If one wants, the full manual is a download from VIZIO.COM/SUPPORT.The unit has full back lighting as opposed to edge lighting.  Because it's has full back lighting, the case is deeper (thicker) then edge lit units but for the thicker case, one has much better contrast.  When we compared this unit to other units of similar size and price that were setup next to the unit, we immediately found the image of this unit to be a bit better in overall image quality.It was brighter, cleaner and had more image definition (sharper) than the Vizio unit next to it or the Toshiba unit that was a 46" unit, and next in line, to the left, of a three television display.  When one stood in the middle of the three television display, equidistant from this unit and then compared image quality to the 46" Toshiba unit to the left, this unit had the better overall image quality.Colors are excellent.The unit has a 6ms refresh rate.Our cable box provides a 720P/1080i signal and the image quality is excellent.We won't have a Blu-ray player hooked up so I can't comment on 1080P resolution.We have cordless headphones hooked up to this unit and the sound quality is excellent.  The speakers sound fine; not tinny or weak.For easy access, the controls are on the edge of the left bezel.The television has, as is typical, two connection sites.  One on the left edge of the bezel and one on the same side but in the back.If I have to give some negative ink, it would be no 3-D, no 120Hz feature and lacks any Wi-Fi capability for easy software upgrade capability.  Nothing that a convenient thumb drive won't fix.FYI, the stand is a fixed stand and does not have the much needed base, swivel component.Other then these obvious niggles that with the exception of a missing swivel component, for a hundred dollars more, the sibling version has the listed missing features.  At the time of writing this review, I have no user complaints and if one is looking for a budget minded, 42", full back lit, LCD television with a great image, in my opinion, this unit will make you happy.  In short, there are no shortcomings to feel the need to get over.Hope the above helps in your buying decision........................................Note: When I made the purchase, I purchased the extended three year warranty contract.Disclosure: the unit we have was purchased yesterday at a big box warehouse.  The purpose of the review is to help Amazon.com family members with their buying decision.

Reviews.Title: Great TV! Stand and positioning is a little strange...
Reviews.Author: KDM
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a TV for the kitchen that fits in a cabinet so I had a limited size that I could work with. I really wanted at least a 26 inch TV.I had originally purchased a Samsung UN26EH4000 26 inch LED TV based on the excellent reviews,however when I got it hooked up I was dismayed with the pixelated picture quality with my DirecTV HD receiver.I started looking for other 26 or 28 inch TVs when I saw this 29 inch Vizio. I looked at the product dimensions hoping it would fit and to my surpise it was an exact match! And it was 3 inches larger than the Samsung to boot! At the time there were no reviews available so I really didn't have anything to go by except for prior experience with a 22" Vizio LED (still working, just wanted something larger). I decided to buy it knowing that Amazon has a great returns policy. I figured I would compare it to the Samsung and return which ever one I did not like.The assembly of the TV is very easy. The stand is not a typical flat panel stand (more on this later). It installs easily by just snapping into place and there are 2 screws that are hidden from the bottom to install. Very easy to install though. From there it is typical install of plugging in your cables.This TV has 2 HDMI ports, and the first port supports Audio Return Channel (ARC) which is a nice feature if you are going to hook up an AV receiver. It also supports standard composite and component connections and a PC connection.For audio connections it has an optical audio out connection and a 1/8 inch mini-jack audio out. This 1/8 inch jack is a standard headphone jack and the volume control of the TV controls the volume of this jack. THe Samsung TV does NOT have this feature and I sorely missed it. I use the 1/8 mini jack to hook up a nice pair of computer speakers for better sound and being able to turn off the TV speakers and still use the volume control from the remote to control external speakers is a great convenience.The picture on this TV is noticely nicer than the picture on the Samsung. Within a minute of hooking it up my wife instantly said this picture was noticeably better than the Samsung, which is strange because when I mentioned that I didn't like the Samsung picture she said it looked fine to her! Women, go figure! Just kidding. Both are 720p resolution but the Vizio is a much nicer picture. When you are close to the TV (within 3-5 feet or so you can start to notice a lower resolution but from a greater distance, 720p is more than adequate. I would suggest getting 1080p for anything larger.The internal speakers really are not too bad. They aren't surround sound quality but they are fairly robust and actually sort of loud. I forgot to plug in the external speakers at first and though they were being used because the sound was that good. As with most flat panel TV's there is very little bass.THe only strange (not negative, just different) thing about this TV is the stand. This TV does not have a standard upright stand. The stand consists of a V shaped bar that attaches at the bottom back of the TV and the TV actually leans back about 5 degrees to stand up. For my application this is good and bad. The tilt actually helps alleviate some glare from straight on light sources. For us, this TV is in an upper cabinet in the kitchen the TV leans back and it looks a little strange sitting in the cabinet, but in no way affects the functionality. Just be aware that it sits this way when purchasing. One of the stock images shows the approximate tilt of the TV when using the stand. It also has standard VESA mounts if you wanted to utilize an arm.The TV itself is slim. It isn't the slimmest TV but it is pretty slim. The outside frame is also minimal and provides for an overall sleek appearance to the TV.Aside from the funky stand, I would rate this TV a 4.95 stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: audio cuts out - a possible solution
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I selected this model for its 1080P resolution (rare in this size class). I had purchased one, and the audio continued to shut off, and as others have said, the only way to restore volume was to turn tv off and then back on, a process which takes 30-45 sec.  This happened 6x so far today, random and irregular.  Went to customer service at Vizio, they said I could send it in for repair, 3 week turnaround.  Not going to happen.  Returned to BJ's, got a replacement, and it is doing the same thing. I see others share this problem, and it is clearly a Vizio issue.  Vizio then suggested getting FIOS to change the audio output of the set top box (convertor box) from digital audio to PCM audio.  Verizon FIOS could not help me with that so far.  Vizio told me that some cable boxes seem to trigger the vizio set to shut its volume off. Be forewarned on this model.  Do not know if it can affect other vizio sets or not. (Have no problem with my 47" vizio in living room.) This set had decent sound and a nice picture, but this problem is annoying to say the least.  I will next try replacing the HDMI cable with the component cables, but this means 5 cables stuffed behind the tv vs. the nice simple HDMI cable! UPDATE:I did replace the HDMI with the 5 component cables and this seems to have solved the problem.  Hope this helps someone else...

Reviews.Title: Re: comments about brightness
Reviews.Author: D. Connor
Reviews.Content: A number of people have commented on the lack of brightness with this TV. I had the same experience and considered returning it. Then i read the review by Greta J Stager and started looking for the auto dim feature. Once I found it and turned it off this TV went to GREAT. I would have rated it 5 stars, but went with 4 because Vizio documentation is so inadequate that we have to come here to find out how to use their products.For others out there: go to Menu>Picture>More>Advanced PictureAmbient Light Sensor and turn it off.

Reviews.Title: Considered returning but going to keep
Reviews.Author: Sigglet
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for our bedroom...finally ready to upgrade from an ancient, miniscule television.Despite only having 1 review at the time of purchase, I selected this model based upon size-to-cost, Vizio's reputation, product specs. and because it has a digital/optical audio out. Surprizingly, and probably to the disappointment of many who later buy sound bars/systems, many Samsungs/LGs around this size/price range do not have a digital out. That's idiotic even for low end systems.Packaging was excellent. (Though if you have delivery concerns re: security/theft note it ships in a Vizio box - people are going to know it's a brand new flat screen. I arrived home to it just sitting in my common entranceway.)Set-up is straightforward and super-fast. Remote is well-built but nothing special. Sound is suffcient for casual viewing, but for gaming or an immersive movie watching experiance you'll need to upgrade. (That's true of almost all internal TV speakers.) Sound maintains well at high volumes.Black levels are quite good for such an inexpensive TV. Level of detail is great and I haven't noticed any artifacts, trails, etc. BUT, as other reviewers noted, there is a brightness issue with this unit - noticed it right away. Menu options are basic and, because there is no real backlight control, it doesn't seem changing settings would remedy the problem. I spent a couple of days going back and forth, trying to decide whether I should return this TV - it's just nowhere near as bright as the 46" Samsung LCD in my living room. But because we are using it in the bedroom, typically with the lights low or off, I've decided to keep it. It's a good quality unit at an excellent price, and other than the backlight issue, delivers in every way.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, not great
Reviews.Author: MinneMan "CJ"
Reviews.Content: Unboxing it, I was impressed by the construction and design.  I didn't see evidence of cutting corners to keep price down.Turning it on, I wasn't impressed by the picture at all.  It was dim and had too much contrast and not enough gradation of tones.  None of the presets were useable so I had tailor a custom setup.  It took some messing around with the settings over a couple of days to get a picture I could be satisfied with.  The automatic backlighting feature, which adjusts the brightness to the room's ambient lighting, was getting in the way so I had to disable it.Comparing it with two other flat screens TV's I have (non-LED), I think this one is the least bright and the least able to finely render the delicate color shading of skin tones.  It also seems to have an odd color palette on solid tone graphics.  I have two computer monitors that are LED and are they're bright and render color very well, so I don't blame the picture deficiency on being LED design.To get it bright enough for my needs, it lost some of the depth of the blacks, but it's not bad in that regard.  The image is sharp enough to read very small text across the room.  Viewing angle is superb in all directions.  The image doesn't change in appearance as you move from side to side.The sound is decent.  You won't need an add on sound system unless you want to hear bass.  The SRS surround simulator is interesting.  It can over-exaggerate the spread of the sound sometimes, but it does help on most content.  The feature that automatically rides the volume for you is pretty useful.The remote is quite nice and was easy for me to learn, although I don't need it.  The thin frame case is simple and elegant.  The base is very stable.  The screen is not very anti-glare and I can see reflections from windows and lamps pretty clearly when the unit is turned off.  Not a big issue when it's on.It has 2 HDMI inputs along with the older style analog inputs.  For those adding a sound system, it has an optical output (fixed volume) and a pair of RCA outputs (selectable fixed or variable volume).All things considered, it's a good value.  It seems well made.  If you're looking for a knockout picture or wanting to use it in a very bright room, maybe there are better choices out there.  If I weren't very tightly constrained by the space I have to fit a TV into, I probably would have returned it for a 40", of which there seem to be a lot more to choose from.

Reviews.Title: Vizio has many quality problems
Reviews.Author: Bob G
Reviews.Content: After only 14 months both of the HDMI ports on my Vizio failed. Vizio customer service acknowledged the problem and tried to help with the power hold down fix. But both of the hdmi ports will not accept any input. At that point, Vizio apologized but there was nothing they could do since I had the TV more than 12 months.My cable operator advised me to use component cables (as so many other vizio TV's have the same problem).Now, I can no longer use my Roku player or my DVD player (as they only have are HDMI outputs).To produce a TV with such poor quality and limit the use of a relatively new TV to just 1 input (component cables only) is just unacceptable. I have never experienced such poor quality in a TV. Moreover, the internet is filled with various Vizio problems and recalls. Beware - if you want to have a TV for many years.

Reviews.Title: Careful! Most reviews are not for this TV size!!!
Reviews.Author: frankinwash
Reviews.Content: Although the details in fine print above the reviewer's text provide the product model, I wish Amaxon would not mix reviews for similar but not the same product together. Luckily in this case most reviewers diferentiate the 22" and 24" review in their text.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value for $
Reviews.Author: Nate Woerner
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV a few weeks ago and love it. The picture is amazing and it is large enough for everyone to see in my massive living room. The only real problem with the TV was a noticeable dimming of the middle of the TV during movies as well as TV shows. At arbitrary times the Vizio would get dark in the very middle of the entire screen. I was able to fix the problem doing the following:1) Go into the picture menu and you will find the option for more that will take you to the advanced picture menu.2) Under the advanced picture menu you will find "Adaptive Luma" which you would want to set to off and the "Smart Dimming" which would need to be set to off as well.3) If these settings are off but the issue is still occurring then we would perform a series of resets to the TV. The first reset would be to unplug the TV from the wall outlet and then press and hold the power button on the TV itself for 30 seconds and then plug the TV back in. Test to see if the problem is still happening after reset.4) If issue is still happening after the power cycle of the TV then we would factory reset the TV by pressing menu on the remote, going in to "help" on the menu and selecting "clear memory (factory default)". The default code is 0000. It will ask you if you're sure you want to reset and then select yes and the TV will turn off and then back on.5) After the factory reset go back in to the advanced picture menu and make sure the "Adaptive Luma" and the "Smart Dimming" are still off.The dimming was due to a power-saving setting. I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Room TV
Reviews.Author: shesbadass
Reviews.Content: I ordered this on the 13th of Nov and got it the 14th :D !!! and that was with super savers shipping.it was a fairly easy set up, its also a really thin tv. i happen to think the stand is genius.the actual picture to me is great, im not to experienced on quality. but its a clear picture, nothing is blurred. i can read all of the numbers and words with ease.my only issue is the panoramic view is THE WORST. the middle of the screen is perfect but the outer corner area stretches as if you're looking in a magnifying glass. so i will never use that option. other than that its great and i like it a lot.this is my 2nd vizio tv.

Reviews.Title: Works great easy set up
Reviews.Author: Greta J Stager
Reviews.Content: We got this as a gift for my 89 year old grandmotherSo we did not want something to complicated but we wanted the qualityThis was a perfect combination. Just an FYI make sure you remove the auto dim or you wonder why it doesn't look as bright as it should. We figured this out and it made the tv pop.

Reviews.Title: Such a great deal.
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I didn't buy this TV from Amazon. I got it refurbished from another store for under $200.APPEARANCE:This is a great looking TV. The pictures make it look extremely thick, but it's really not---and the bezel is thin enough to make it look more modern than most other TVs.The thin bezel also allows the screen to be a little bigger than most 32" TVs, even though it takes up the same amount of space. So that's nice. This TV is the perfect size for a small bedroom. For a living room, game room, or bigger bedroom, you'll want something bigger.SETUP:Relatively straightforward. You have to attach the TV to the stand, basically. There are two sets of screws, and the manual doesn't make it clear enough which screws go where. I had some trouble because of this. Maybe I'm just dumb. Just remember that the longer screws are used to attach the base to the stand, while the shorter screws attach the stand to the actual TV.Once you power on the TV for the first time, it guides you through some really simple setup steps. No big deal. After that, you're free to change whatever other settings you want.REMOTE:It's a remote. I guess there's nothing wrong with it, but it doesn't have a backlight and it can ONLY be used to control the TV, so I'd recommend using a nice universal remote instead.VIDEO QUALITY:Coming from a 27" CRT, this is an amazing upgrade. The black levels and sound (both common complaints for non-CRT TVs) are phenomenal. You'll have to mess around with the picture settings to get everything perfect, but that's to be expected.This is only a 32" TV, so 1080p is unnecessary. Save yourself some money and go with 720p.If I have to make one complaint, I've noticed that really dark scenes can sometimes appear a little too dark, but it's not a huge problem.AUDIO QUALITY:Much better than I expected. The bass isn't going to shake your house, but if you put this TV in a small room, it doesn't sound the least bit empty or tinny.FEATURES:This is a very barebones TV, but that's fine with me. I would've appreciated a third HDMI port, but again, I can't complain for the price. Plus, it's not like switches don't exist.I also would've appreciated separate composite and component inputs---one of the ports is shared, so you'll have to pick one or the other. Most TVs I've seen have multiple composite/component inputs, but this TV only has one...again, not a big deal, since I already have a switch.There's also no internet connectivity (you'll want the E320i-A0 for that), so no "smart" TV features are available. This won't be a problem for anyone who already has a Wii, Wii U, PS3, Blu-ray player, or any other device that can run Netflix, Hulu, etc.The USB port only allows you to view pictures, which is sort of useless for me, but some people might find it handy. I purchased an HDMI media player to watch movies with.I guess what I'm saying is that as long as you're fine with buying several cheap devices to add functionality, this TV is a great starting point. If you're the type of person that likes to have everything on one device, you might want to spend a little more. But for the price I paid, I definitely recommend the E320-A1.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: sondra fields
Reviews.Content: Did not work. Could not get it to come on at all. It would not program. Evidently someone else had it before and it was re-packaged and sold again. But it had been set, and it was impossible for me to get it to reset and perform.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Ronald W. Betz
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my wife for our bedroom.  I treat her too well, I know.  We have a big screen Viziothat we like, so I trust the brand.  The picture is quite good, and you can tell that you have 1080p.  She watchesthis TV while reading in bed, putting on makeup, etc.  The only drawback is the sound; it is tinny and small.I offered to hook up auxiliary speakers, but my wife refused.  She is the only person I know who does not likesurround sound.  She thinks the sound is fine.  Hey, if she's happy, I'm happy.  I detract one star for the sound--otherwise, excellent TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice 32-inch TV - Has Digital Audio Out,  2 HDMI, 1USB
Reviews.Author: Katawampas
Reviews.Content: I bought this on sale at another store. This model is not a "Smart" TV; the "Smart" model is the Vizio E320i-A0.  I use a Roku so don't need "Smart".  Overall, I'm happy with the TV.  Has a good picture, OK sound & the connections I need.  I use this as a bedroom TV & it works great for that.  I do not have cable or satellite so I use antenna; I can see the city tower from my house so I have wonderful reception.I own 3 additional Vizio TVs & they have been very good/dependable.Pros:-Very good picture; the black levels are very good & the colors are accurate.-Has digital audio out-3.5 mm analog audio out (side) - headphone/earphone jack*Note, some consumers are saying this TV no longer has a headphone jack.  Mine does, but maybe Vizio made a change & the TV no longer has the jack.  Go to Vizio's website for specific spec information.  There is a cheap & easy work-around if you only have RCA jacks.  Buy this:2 x RCA Male, 1 x 3.5mm Stereo Female, Y-Cable 6-Inch  It will allow you to plug in your 3.5 mm headphones.-2 HDMI (1 side, 1 back)-1 USB (side)-Slim frame design looks really nice & takes up less space horizontally/vertically.  The TV is still kind of "thick" but that's because it has the LEDs mounted behind the screen NOT along the edge.-Direct-Lit/Full-Array LED; NOT the CCFL Edge-Lit.-Matte Screen is pretty good in a bright room but not excellent; some minor reflections.-The 32-inch model has a plastic rectangular stand not the strange triangle/leaning version on the 29-inch TV.-Audio is better than most TVs in this size/price.  It has 2 -10W speakers.  It's not audiophile quality but acceptable & better than many.-SRS TruVolume which evens out the spikes in volume.  This used to be an issue with commercials but with the passage & implementation of the CALM Act (Law passed by Congress that makes it illegal for commercials to be broadcast at louder volume) that's less of an issue.  It can still be helpful when streaming movies, etc.-Ambient Light Sensor - I'm kind of indifferent to this feature.-Simple RemoteCons:-Unlit remote, small buttons-Stand doesn't swivel-No "Smart Dimming" (Vizio's name for Local Dimming)-60Hz-720p-No dedicated PC connection but you can use HDMI with the proper cords.-No Ethernet-Guide - My old Vizio's have the guide that shows what is currently on & what is coming up.  This new Vizio only shows what is currently on the channel.  I really liked the old way because I could see what TV programs will be shown throughout the day.FYI:  The base/stand measurement is 15" x 7.5"  VESA Mount Standard: 100mm x 100mm

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price, provided you don't need streaming video.
Reviews.Author: Expressed Reviews "Expressed Reviews"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the VIZIO E601i-A3 60-inch 1080p 120Hz Razor LED Smart FHDTV, an absolutely phenomenal TV with every conceivable feature you could ask for. Wanting to get a smaller TV for a second bedroom, I stumbled upon the TV featured here, the VIZIO E320-A1 32-inch 720p 60Hz LED HDTV TV at a friends house. He had just purchased it from Amazon. Upon checking out the TV; I felt as if it was missing some features that I was looking for. My friend was a little upset, but eventually pleased when I told him that he might want to return it to Amazon and get something else. While the picture and sound are excellent on this model; unless you're only buying a TV for the basics; I'd spend a little extra and get one that has more features than this. On the other hand; if all you need are the basics, look no further, as you won't find a better picture on any other 32" TV. This one comes with only 2 HDMI ports, which in my opinion is too few. There's no picture in picture, and more importantly, there's no Apps for streaming video. It comes with a very thin bezel(a great feature), as do all of the new Vizio TV's. The 720P resolution is superb, and is all that's needed on a TV of this size. As mentioned above; the surround sound was exceptional and quite an improvement over previous generation Vizio TV's. While at his house; I watched a few minutes of a soccer game, and found the picture to be extremely stable, with virtually no blurring effect during movement. The problem with the TV(for some people, not all) is that for the price, or slightly more; you can get one that has a lot more features. My friend knew nothing about streaming video, as he gets Netflix DVD's by mail. When I told him about the streaming feature available on most new TV's; he agreed that he had probably made a bad choice for him, which does not mean that this would be a bad choice for others. The bottom line is that if you're looking for a basic TV without streaming capability; this is an excellent choice. If you want more features, such as are available on most new TV's, than I would look elsewhere. Keep in mind that many people have no interest in streaming video, and as such this TV IS a superb choice.

Reviews.Title: So much bang for the buck, it's hard to believe.
Reviews.Author: Manaan
Reviews.Content: There are two things you need to look for when buying a TV.1. Contrast Ratio. Average TV's have about 1:4000 to 1:7000. This thing has 1:100,000. That alone should add $100 to the price of this TV, but yet it's only $388.2. Refresh rate. 60 Hz is plenty for a TV. 60 is approaching the upper limits of human eye capability, forking out $$$ for a 120 or going for lower-quality plasma for a 600 Hz refresh rate is pointless.Smart TV's are pointless when you have BR players with youtube, netflix, pandora, etc built in them. Or you can also get a Roku.This is about the best deal you're ever going to find for a sub-40'' TV. It's pretty big, but it's definitely not a "kitchen" TV. This is definitely a college students' living room TV, or a rich persons bedroom TV.The sound is decent. There's no sub-woofer/bass, so if you want to feel the sound in the floor you're going to have to get a sound system.The auto-dim adjust feature makes this thing work out-of-the-box without having to fiddle with settings. I've read some reviews on this where people have to manually adjust it because they have a weird home lighting situation, but for most people that won't be the case.

Reviews.Title: 2nd time around, all is good !
Reviews.Author: Sound_Off
Reviews.Content: The first one was no good. Picture was fuzzy, off color and just not what I thought it should be. Called Visio, talked to the tech, went through some adjustments and still not right. I had a feeling it might not be right when we saw there was some damage to the one corner of the box it came in. Next called AMAZON. They are great!~ Had a new one shipped out the next day after shipping the first one back. What a difference. This is what a Visio should be. Picture is great and the audio is also very good compared to most in this size.

Reviews.Title: Thoroughly Acceptable LED TV
Reviews.Author: kpc001
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV at Costco for the same price.  I wanted to provide my impressions of the model.  I find actual user reviews to be very helpful when deciding on whether to buy a TV or any electronic device.This TV is not a top of the line Vizio model.  This is a good, entry level LED TV. The TV looks great. It has a very thin bezel, which makes the screen look even bigger.  The Vizio user interface is easy to use.  The included remote only works the TV, but our cable remote functions well to control the TV.Now, as to the picture.  This is the heart of the matter.  I'm used to LCD screens, which seem brighter out of the box than LED.  This TV's picture was very dark and washed out when I set it up.  Partly is was my familiarity with LCD screens that made the screen look so dark by comparison.  The Vizio pre-set picture modes all seemed dark.  The Vivid mode was the brightest, and is the mode I use for all inputs with some adjustments. I have either turned off or lowered the Vizio automatic ambient light adjustment that comes automatically set on the TV.  I found that it kept the screen too dark.  By turning it off, the picture has brightened considerably.I expect that most users will probably need to adjust the picture mode to suit their taste.  This has to be done for each input (TV, HDMI, etc.).  The mode and adjustments you select for an input only apply to that input.  While this is a bit frustrating, it does make sense.  Over the air TV, cable input, or streaming video will be fed into the TV through different inputs and will need different adjustments to achieve the optimal picture.  If you really don't like the adjustments you've made, the good news is that there is a reset button to reset the adjustments you made to the TV to factory settings.  If I remember, this does reset all the picture modes to factory settings. The most bang for the buck with adjustments is the backlighting and contrast.  This really helps picture quality and brightness.I find that the picture is relatively sharp, but still not as sharp as the LCD screens I'm used to.  However, the overall look of all programs on the TV, including the HD programs streaming through my Roku, look very good.A few comments about the sound.  For a TV at this price, you might expect the sound to be somewhat thin.  It is not.  The sound quality is very good.  We have this TV in our bedroom, and rely on the TV's speakers for sound.  The sound is relatively full, with not a lot of bass.  You can hook the TV into your sound system, and you have the flexibility to set the TV to deliver digital or analog signal (and you can select the type of digital processing you need).After several days of use, I have come to appreciate the picture on the TV.  While still not overly bright, the contrast and sharpness is pleasing.  My rating of 4 out of 5 is based primarily upon the price and the acceptable TV picture after adjustment.  You aren't going to find a better picture or value at this price point.  You can spend more, but this TV works very well for us. To be clear, though, I wouldn't consider this TV as the centerpiece of a top-notch home theater system.  For that, you will probably want to spend more (probably much more) for a much better out-of-the box picture.  But if you want a good TV for casual use, this TV is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: Good picture with flaws
Reviews.Author: sadatoni
Reviews.Content: A week ago I purchased this television.  There are many things about it that are quite good... color, brightness, dark areas, all adjustable.  Sound is good, once I found the equalizer settings.  A couple of days later I noticed vignetting in the corners.  Later, watching a show that did a lot of panning, it became clear that the backlighting is uneven.  So I went to a local store to look at another one.  Same issue, uneven backlighting.  It can best be described as looking through a sheet of glass with dust smudges scattered about it.  For me, the reason to upgrade to a new TV is for the picture quality and sound.  Unfortunately, this model has picture quality issues.

Reviews.Title: Took it back
Reviews.Author: JEFFREY L. FINN
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for our Cabin based on the excellent experience we currently have with our 55 inch Vizio at home.  The 32 inch size is perfect for the cabin and the picture we were completely happy with.  However the sound was a bit to be desired. At times the sound was just fine and at times the speakers sounded like they were blown. Sounded like we had the speakers over loaded. Completely annoying. We watched 3 different DVD's because we are in the sticks so to speak and can not get any signal.  Cable is not available and we do not pay for Dish or Direct TV.  So our signal comes from a Sony Blu Ray with a HDMI cable.  All 3 movies were the same sound wise.  So we took it back and bought a 32 Samsung 4003 series TV.  I honestly can not say the Samsung is better or worst picture wise but the sound is superior in comparison to the Vizio. This last rainy weekend we watched 3 DVD's some were Blu Ray and some were not.  We could not tell which was a Blu Ray and which one was not. So the Samsung has a new home and we are happier for it.I do wish the Vizio worked out because I know the control panel by heart and it is much easier to set up. I feel that the Vizio has a more user friendly system with more optional settings to customize. But the sound was the deal breaker.It was something we just could not live with.I do want to comment that Vizio 800 number customer service was excellent to deal with. They could not help me but the customer service person did try. I guess you can not fix a design problem over the phone.  And I did not get the impression I was calling a 3rd world country. I really liked that.

Reviews.Title: Excellent deal for the size & price
Reviews.Author: John Young
Reviews.Content: i had a smaller entertainment center and could only fit a 32" wide HD TV in the space. When I found this 39" slim design TV and saw the width measurements would allow it to fit by 1/4" ......I bought it. Its a tight fit but the picture is all the way out to all the edges and the color is great. I just wanted a replacent for my 32" TV that had gone out but this Vizio TV looks good and has a great picture. Had to tweak the sound as its a little low probably because there is such a small frame. I wish there was a manual but its available on-line if you have any issues.

Reviews.Title: Good or Bad??
Reviews.Author: M. McAdams
Reviews.Content: i didn't know whether to rate this one star or five stars so i chose three...as usual, amazon is amazing, got the telly exactly when they said it would be here...i hooked it up to an xbox 360 via HDMI & launched a gameand marveled at the graphics for 20-30 minutes...then the picture went dark, blank except a dim backlight to let me know it was still "on"although i couldn't see picture i could still hear sound from the game through the telly speakers...not sure if this was a manufacturing defect or a shipping incident...anyway i rung up amazon customer support on the phoneand a very nice gentleman walked me through a troubleshooting hard-reset of the tellyto no avail...so he set up a new telly to be shipped to me with 1-day shippingand set up UPS to come pick up the old one and send it back.they charge $1 to your credit card for this, but after the telly is delivered to youthe $1 is refunded.to conclude...when it works, it's great! and when it doesn't, it doesn't...however amazon customer support was very quick and friendly(i didn't wait for more than 5 minutes to speak with a REAL personand not once did i have to speak with a dumb automated voice machine)and i have no doubt that i'll be with a new telly in the next few days.tschuß, Mick

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Munsey "Steph066"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to order this TV due to the lack of reliable reviews online. However, CNET.com had reviewed similar models with good reviews, so I felt confident in the purchase. The TV is packaged well and set up is a breeze.The TV looks great with its narrow edge around the screen. In other words, you get a lot of picture for the size. The picture quality is actually quite good. All my shows just "pop" from the screen. Colors and crispness are great. The picture settings out of the box are "just OK" in my opinion, but after some calibration suggestions from CNET and a bit of individual tweaking, I was able to adjust the picture to my liking. There are plenty of options within the picture menu to adjust the back lighting, brightness, tint, and all the typical adjustments. The main adjustment I had to make was the brightness. I had to turn this up quite far. The Ambient Light Sensor setting automatically adjusts the picture to the lighting of the room. I suggest turning this "off" or "Minimal" to keep the picture bright enough. There are plenty of connection options on this set, so no problems there. Since purchasing this set, I've noticed a lot of positive reviews of this set. It's a great TV at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV, surprised it costs so little
Reviews.Author: Seth Balmore
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to use for gaming and watching movies in my bedroom. The 32 inch screen feels almost theater-size compared to the 20-inch I used to have in my room. It's hard to tell without seeing it in person, but the TV is very classy looking and should look good in any home. The thing I love most is how thin the bezel is. In a dark room the screen just kinda floats there.As for quality and features, the biggest drawback of this television is obviously the lack inputs. I lucked out because I'm ONLY using this TV to play video games and watch movies, but others might find the number of inputs completely inadequate. There are only two HDMI ports, which is bad enough, but the Component and Composite inputs are shared as well, placing huge limits on the number of items you can connect. If you're a gamer like me then you're limited to only one old-school console. And if you're setting this up for basic TV and movies then think very carefully about the components you'll have to hook up and if you have the proper connections.I won't say much about the sound and speakers because if you actually care about audio then you've already got a solution for that. But if you just need a TV for the bedroom then the sound should be fine for you.The picture on the TV is clear and the colors are rich and deep, but the standard picture setting is overly warm and has way too much contrast. Changing the picture mode to "Computer" relaxed the colors and provided a true white. I lowered the contrast and raised the brightness almost to max in order to achieve an almost perfect picture. It takes a LOT of tweaking, but this product is certainly capable of a displaying a nice picture.EDIT 8/20/13 *After owning the TV for several months and calibrating it properly, I have to say that it's one of the best looking televisions I've ever seen. Proper calibration is important. High end TVs are probably capable of a superior picture, but I've never seen one set up correctly! Using the free "AVS HD 709" calibration tool, I was able to get the black and white levels perfect. Using the same tool on a 50-inch Bravia I couldn't achieve settings of the same accuracy. Whatever you do don't settle for the factory/showroom settings. *END EDIT*One thing I couldn't figure out was how to change the backlight level. You have to find the Advanced Picture Settings and set "ambient light sensor" to Off or Low. What the ambient light sensor does is adjust the backlight based on the amount of light in the room. It's actually a very useful feature, but enabling it removes backlight control completely.An interesting thing I noticed is that the TV is advertised as 720p, but when receiving a 1080p signal the display reads "1080p" in the right corner. So maybe it IS displaying 1080p? Who knows. Regardless, the picture looks phenomenal. I'd say it's on par with my 50-inch Sony Bravia. Another thing I like is the design of the remote. It's very small, sleek, and easy to use.I tried to cover all the little things that separate this TV from others. But if you're just looking for a cheap TV with a great picture, you can put your faith in this one. It's really a beautiful television and the ONLY thing I can really complain about is the lack of inputs.

Reviews.Title: Not the best color
Reviews.Author: joe jarvis "magnoila joe"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this LED HDTV for price, size and for having had great results with another Vizio TV.  But like another reviewer, I also found everything about this one great except that the color is less than I expected.  Lacks richness and brightness that I get from my 46 inch Samsung or 32 inch Vizio.  Customizing settings and tweaking didn't seem to improve picture quality enough to satify me.  My experience with Amazon, start to finish, couldn't be better and I may contact them to see about returning this set and purchasing the 40" Samsung in a similar price range.

Reviews.Title: Vizio LED HDTV- mostly good
Reviews.Author: A. Jaynes
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived in very good condition. Packaging was blemish free and very secure looking. I like many things about the TV. And there is one thing I am not so pleased with. I like that it uses efficient LED. I like that the stand is removable if you want to wall mount it. I like the quality of sound. I like that it receives more channels than our other TV does.There is just one issue...it is a little dim. By comparison to our plasma in the front room, you have to make sure you have the right angle away from light to be able to enjoy this fully. I have tried playing with all the settings and spent a considerable amount of time trying different color options etc, and it still is a little dim for my preferences. But it is in out bedroom, so....half the time I just want to listen to the nightly news or whatever anyway. If I could make it bright enough when I want, that would earn 5 stars. And some people may find it enough, it's not like its terribly dim, but I am used to the vivid colors of our Plasma I guess.

Reviews.Title: Terrible USB playback support
Reviews.Author: jdroadie
Reviews.Content: The TV seemed OK but we needed to play video's off the "multimedia" USB port.....the information on this feature is almost non existent...the manual seems to indicate it only plays pictures. The only other source of info comes by using Chat on Vizio's website.There they tell you it does video in VOB (really ripped DVD's) AVI (no codec specified, we went 0 for 5) and WMV...pretty mainstream, we went 0 for 3 on three different methods. We even had JPGs that wouldn't display.So IF you need to play back materials from a USB stick THIS IS NOT THE TV for you. It's USB port is a waste of time & materials.The picture is far less bright then our Sharp's too and they play almost anything on USB

Reviews.Title: E320-A1 32" TV
Reviews.Author: Kaan
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a month and I am liking it quite a lot with the following settings:Picture mode: MovieBacklight: 59Brightness: 53Contrast: 75Color: 50Tint: -3Sharpness: 2Color Temperature: CustomRed Gain: 26Green Gain: 30Blue Gain: 41Red Offset: 49Green Offset: 50Blue Offset: 53Advanced Picture: Everything set to OFFI ended up with these settings thanks to Cnet's review of a nearly-identical TV, the E320i-A0. I adjusted the color temperature values from that tv's 256-point scale to this tv's 100-point scale. I hope this helps anyone who is looking for some decent settings for this TV.

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: James H Hoffman
Reviews.Content: I bought it as it was highly rated in Consumer Reports. Excellent quality, sound and sharp picture.It has good features.

Reviews.Title: Sexy tv
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Really thin, reeeeealy light. Perfect to use as a monitor or small bedroom tv. Dont buy this tv thinking that its going to serve as a set to watch the Sunday game on in your living room. Its got a 60Hz refresh rate. Thats as slow as it gets as far as HDTVs are concerned so as expected there is a tiny bit of motion blur. Its barely noticible but if youre used to a 600Hz set you will see it. Also, dont plan on being overwhelmed by in-your-face audio. Its not going to happen. The super slim design and thin bezel dont leave room for much speaker. I have the 22" version of this model as a computer monitor and Im using this 29" for my bedroom. Overall 4.75 out of 5. Just educate yourself about the right tv for your situation and youll be happy.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E420-Ao 42"
Reviews.Author: george
Reviews.Content: The picture on this set is perfect right out of the box. Three screws hold the base on using the supplied screws and Allen wrench, I hooked up my basic cable and did a channel scan. Even with only basic cable this picked up over 100 channels. i have my Blu-ray player hooked up via HDMI and a Karaoke machine hooked up on the composite video jacks and they all work fantastic. I don't care for the either composite or component sharing the same ports as I could use the inputs, but there are ways around that. I got the Amazon credit card getting me $50 off for $398 I couldn't pass this up. The tv looks fantastic with it's narrow frame.I think this is more than I could ask for especially at this price. Now there are better tv's I am sure, but the price would be double.Quit thinking and just get this, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Not at all disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Happy in Joisey
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous because we had based our decision to purchase this tv on the excellent reviews of the previous model (reviews were not yet available for this newer version of the tv at the time). I'm happy to say that from the minute the package arrived we have been delighted with our choice! The tv is very light and there is little assembly needed (to attach the base). I was very nervous about the actual hook-up of the tv with our other electronics because my husband and I can be a bit technologically challenged. But I'm happy to report that it was effortless. Truly! Someone out there has finally created a tv-for-dummies and we found it! On top of everything else, it's a great picture with great sound. My husband commented that the (movie) credits are so crisp that they seem like they pop out at us. We are very happy and would recommend this tv to others.

Reviews.Title: Nearly a month of fiddling with the picture settings
Reviews.Author: Leonard A. Roberge
Reviews.Content: and I could never get rid of obvious, annoying background pixelation, ranging from "dancing" wood grain to 8-bit-blocky skies. Blacks, browns, yellows, greens, and reds were especially pixely, and blues sometimes looked bad, too. This was with a variety of sources -- FiOS cable, over-the-air HDTV, HBO GO, Netflix streaming -- and with various HDMI and component-video cables. Even Blu-rays suffered from this problem, although less so than other material. I plugged, unplugged, reversed, switched, tweaked to no avail -- and finally decided it wasn't faulty connections or compressed broadcasts or anything but the TV. I dragged out our eight-year-old, slightly smaller Sony Bravia for comparison -- and there was none. The older set had no digital artifacts and a far more vivid picture overall. The Vizio has gone back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Lines after 5 months!
Reviews.Author: Daniel E. Mostek
Reviews.Content: This was a great tv for the price, until after 5 months it developed a 1.5" thick colored lines.  The picture around the lines were great but I can't watch tv with thick lines in the middle.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Edward J. Kelly V
Reviews.Content: This was max size I could fit in RV and it is great.  The picture from sat or ant is outstanding.  I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Overlander "Just Another parent"
Reviews.Content: Hooked the TV up and I was impressed with the picture quality and sound.  Of course it doesn't compare to a true Home Theater audio quality, but I don't think I'm going to need a soundbar either.  It doesn't have apps, but we don't need to since we'll be using a ROKU box anyways.  Only 2 HDMI inputs but then again .. if you would have a home theater system that wouldn't be much of a problem.  Again .. glad I bought this one :)

Reviews.Title: Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: lballe40
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv because I had the same model a few years ago when Vizios first started becoming popular. I was not disappointed with the second purchase. I've read some reviews negatively referring to the sound, but I don't have any complaints. If I wanted hidef sound I would use my receiver and Dolby digital surround sound. The picture is amazing. The tv itself is sleek and looks great. 10/10 I would buy a third.

Reviews.Title: Too many problems
Reviews.Author: Barbara A. Merson "angeltime"
Reviews.Content: Was so excited to receive this TV but my excited left really quick - Serious audio-video issues with theTV turning on and off at random and the backlight of the television stay  on losing the picture.  The only wayto get the picture back is to turn off the TV and back on again. I did some research and came up with Vizio released a batch of smart TV's with bad chips - as inconvenient as it is this one is going back and i will get a refund this time.  The picture is great, when it works, which is why i tried so hard to find a resolution to the problem, but after speaking to both Amazon and Vizio support, apparently there is none.

Reviews.Title: This TV is Crap
Reviews.Author: Charlie in Palm Springs "chasmader"
Reviews.Content: I took a risk and bought this cheap TV.  I figured that as a Vizio, it would work well, and price would not matter.  When I was setting it up, I discovered the attachment for the stand enclosed didn't fit correctly and the set kept falling over. Then, about a month into owning it, a red line has burned itself into the picture.My friend bought the same model and he's having problems with his picture being blurry. My guess is that some of these models are probably ok, but there's a bad production run being dumped on the market at very low prices and its these models causing the problems.The moral of this review is twofold:  You get what you pay for and if it's to good to be true; it is.

Reviews.Title: Hook up easy, service excellent
Reviews.Author: A. G. Taylor "agtaylor"
Reviews.Content: I love that this TV is easy to hook up and the menu is mostly intuitive.  But it quit showing captioning after a few days, and I had to call for help.  Customer service is for the life of the TV, and I got great service!  Captioning is back.  A small disappointment is that from the side, the picture is not as good as directly in front (colors fade).

Reviews.Title: not so great
Reviews.Author: DivaDawn
Reviews.Content: We have several Vizio TV's and ordering a small size seemed like a no brainer. the TV is very dim and not viewable from certain vantage points. If you get too close or are on an angle the view is bad. The volume is also not good. It has a very tin like sound. Very disappointed. I looked at all of the reviews, and tried to see if the dimming could be improved. thanks for all the great reviews, but on the 22" the 39" review does not help. Options are not the same. I, too, wish Amazon would not mix reviews of different size TV's. I also wish I had not made this investment.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for gaming (PS4 & PS3), not so great as computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Ben Rafert
Reviews.Content: This TV has been stunning for use when gaming with PS4 & PS3. The images are clear & look just the way they should without me having to reprogram colors or anything like that. The TV does come with pre-programmed picture settings like "General, "Movie", "Game", "Vivid", "Football", etc. that influence the colors & brightness (Including other sport options). I tend to stick with game because that's what I'm using it for normally. I did have to dig through it's settings to find the "Ambien Light-Sensor" setting & turn it off because I think it was sensing it's own light & dimming the screen. The speakers might not be the best, however they get the job done fine & they don't offer any problems. It may not be the best as a computer/laptop monitor, but given how the TV does with PS3 & PS4, I doubt it's too much of the TV's fault things aren't too clear. I do use HDMI to connect the TV & computer but I just think it's partly that the TV isn't truly made to be used as a computer display & that the display I have it set to isn't the computer's native display (the other display options morph the picture). The only reason this TV didn't earn 5 stars is just about all because it isn't that great as a computer display. Other notes: Although it is only 60Hz I've come to think that's all you really need on a TV this size.

Reviews.Title: l
Reviews.Author: Sue K
Reviews.Content: NiceTV for the 2  weeks it Worked. Then It Shut Itself Off A Couple Times, Then It Would Not Turn On At All. TV Gets 1 Star, But Amazon Gets 5 Stars For Their Quick & Easy Return Policy!

Reviews.Title: Bad Luck
Reviews.Author: pumkingirl32
Reviews.Content: 2 TV's, both returned. The first TV we purchased lost sound after about 15 hours of use. We chalked it up as a fluke and had a 2nd sent to us and that one lost it's picture after less than 5 hours of use. We will not be purchasing VIZIO products ever again. Amazon was great with the returns and credited our account quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: MacAddict "macaddict"
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this TV is not reviewed more by the main TV reviewers. I just needed a cheap TV to replace an old 32" Samsung that stopped working and I was constrained by the TV cabinet that I have.This TV fits nicely but more importantly I was pleasantly surprise by the picture quality. I've ran through my Digital Video Essentials - HD Basics calibration Blu-Ray and this TV passed all the tests with flying colors.I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Red
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV a few days ago and am very happy with it. Out of the box you will need to set the colors to your liking, it took me about 25-30 minutes to get it just right. If your are getting this TV for gaming it's really good. It has game mode which reduces lag and a good 6ms response time. So far I've played a few PS3 games like Mass Effect 3, Overlord Raising Hell and Call of Duty. I don't notice any lag and very rarely did i notice very little blur. The image looks perfect, bright and crisp. You will have to mess with it for a little while to get the perfect picture you prefer, but it's worth taking the time. It doesn't have any smart functions or internet apps, but for the price it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV! Especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: mjdailey87
Reviews.Content: I've always been a Samsung TV guy and occasionally I've been known to refer someone to a Sony, but last Saturday this TV changed my mind. I always knew Vizio TVs were pretty decent. My girlfriend needed a TV for her bedroom and with the price of TVs being so cheap these days we went for the $400 price point. I looked at LG, Samsung, and Sony TVs in this price point because this is all I would consider.. I really never considered LG, but my girlfriends parents have on in their living-room and its nice. So, I was standing there comparing TVs and this Vizio popped out at me. I figured what the heck and I recommended that she buy it. It looked nicer than all the other TVs at that price so we took it home. Its the nicest TV at that size and that price I've seen. Great TV! If you're thinking about buying one and you do not want to spend more than $400, this is it!! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Warning, worst customer service ever!
Reviews.Author: Desert Rat
Reviews.Content: Warning, worst customer service ever!It is ironic that I did like the TV. However, only four months after buying it, the remote control stopped working. I called Vizio CS, and the agent was helpful in that he explained how to do a reset of the remote (take out the batteries, and then hit every button). However, it still did not work, so he offered to send a replacement. I gave all the information.Shortly thereafter, I got a call stating that even though I purchased it on Amazon, and had sent them a screen shot of the order page, they refused to send a replacement, telling me it was an "unauthorized" vendor.Despite another call, and several emails, still no luck. I got answers to each email wherein I explained simply the problem, yet all they sent back was some canned statement that they could not help, but told me where I could purchase one. I went to that site, but they did not have that model Vizio remote.It is difficult to believe a large company like this would be so cheap that to save the few bucks their remote would cost, they risk losing all my future business as well as that of all my friends and clients.As the TV set only has a power button and nothing else, the set is useless without a working remote.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: robert urfer
Reviews.Content: Having very tight space to work with I had narrowed the search down to this very slim HDTV.  So far I have had the TV for a few weeks and I like it, a lot.  The picture settings in my option definitely need to be tweaked.  I would suggest to go into the Advanced Picture settings and make a few adjustments to increase screen brightness and picture quality.  See below:ADVANCED PICTURENoise Reduction LowMPEG NR LowColor Enhancement NormalAdaptive Luma LowFilm Mode AutoBacklight Control OffAmbient Light Sensor OffTo fine tune your settings for your home, find a Pixar movie and use the THX optimizer and you will see a huge difference.  Additionally, the default coloring is awful.  I Googled some settings from other users and was not satisfied.  As a last ditch I tried the default color settings and found the “Computer” setting as this has the most realistic coloring.  I have on ordered THX glasses (4.99 and free shipping) so I can test the color and tint.  Once they arrive I will update my review with new settings.  Viewing angle isn’t too bad and I have no complaints about overall screen brightness.Overall, this TV is a great value.  Small form factor, good picture quality, mediocre input but hey did I mention it’s a great price!

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted and more.
Reviews.Author: MR
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant at first to get a 720p because I wanted the full HD affect, but I went with this because of the price and the size.The picture is excellent and is clear as can be! It was very easy to set up the tv to my cable box. This model has 2 HDMI ports which will be great to hook up my laptop if i wish to.Can't beat the quality, the price and the 2 day shipping.Would definitely purchase another Vizio without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, compact design
Reviews.Author: Stephen Spruill
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is as good as that of other manufacturers. The design of the stand enabled us to put a much larger set in a shelving unit.

Reviews.Title: Week 1 review excellent, 2 week review do not bother
Reviews.Author: Fräulein P
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV on Sat pm and received it the following Monday afternoon. 5 star Amazon!The packaging is scary as it shipped in the original Vizio box only. 1 star Amazon!Unlike with other reviewers, my UPS guy must have had a good day, the box didn't have any dentsand I had a carefully hand carried delivery. 5 star UPSThere are picture and audio setting aplenty so it will be up to you how do you like to set it.I wanted a bare bones TV since I am using it with my Roku3 set to 1080p. It works perfect via HDMI.My set- upHD cable box (at 1080i) to TV :HDMIRoku 3 (at 1080p) to TV : HDMIDVD (1080i upscale but not Blue Ray, great pic nonetheless) to TV: ComponentPros:Price, excellent bargain with $20 off for Prime members, paid $449 incl. taxand a $5 CA Electronic Waste Recycling Fee (?) , free super fast shipping.Excellent pic and decent audio, no sound bar needed in a small to mid-size room.Intuitive menu options.Sound control actually works and commercials are not blaring anymore.Esthetically pleasing with nice with the thin bezelUpdate:don't buy if you want to watch ball games. Just not suitable at all. The ball looks like it is stopped by each frame.!!!Cons: None that I didn't know about before ie:flimsy remote (I use my Cable box remote, non-issue)2 HDMI's only, (knew that, buy a $10 switch if you need more).Shared Component (if you need more, look elsewhere)Non-swivel stand (knew that, I set mine on an old satin cloth for easy swiveling.My first Vizio and I know nothing about the longevity but I will update as needed.For now I can only recommend this TV if you get it for less than $480 incl.

Reviews.Title: Manufacturing Defect
Reviews.Author: Yossarian
Reviews.Content: My experience was the same as other reviewers in that the tv sound kept muting off. The only way to restore the sound was to turn the tv off then back on again. This must be a quality control problem.  I returned the set and bought a Toshiba 24" which turned out to be an excellent tv--much better quality, much better sound than the Vizio, when the Vizio had sound, and aesthetically more tasteful.

Reviews.Title: A good picture but with serious audio problems
Reviews.Author: G. P. Stern
Reviews.Content: My several year old Sharp 46" TV recently died due to a delaminated diffuser.  As a replacement, I originally purchased an LG 47LN5700.  While at first blush an impressive set, after a couple of weeks I found enough to dislike that I returned it (I have a review of that TV on Amazon).  I bought the Vizio E470-A0 in the hopes that it's lack of whiz-bang features would work in its favor; it has.  Out of the box, the picture is great with little adjusting needed.  The contrast is good; details in white / light color areas aren't blown out.  The sound is quite good but I can't say it's really noticeably better than the LG's although it is better than my old dearly departed Sharp.  The surround function does work quite well, hover, with sound seemingly coming from beyond the TV.There is a little bit of unevenness in terms of the backlighting, but not the worst I've seen and better than I've seen on more expensive sets.  Fast motion doesn't create banding or artifacts, just motion blur (which I am fine with).  It's 60Hz, has no networking or smart capability. I just wanted a solid TV with a good picture and sound which is what I got.My complaints are few:- The remote has to be pointed right at the sensor on the TV.  This is an issue with the remote itself because once programmed, my Universal Remote RF-20 has no such issue.- Like every TV now, there's no S-video, and component and composite jacks are shared so if you need to connect more than one older device, you will need a switch box (I have an S-video and composite device; a converter switch box on Amazon is less than $20).- Also like other current TVs, the screen is somewhat glossy.  Not as reflective as a plasma screen but a lot more reflective than my old Sharp.  I can see my sofa and coffee table reflected in the screen when the image is dark, even without any lights on.  Not a deal breaker since every TV I looked at was the same.  My solution for this (I hope), is the MXH antiglare film from Photodon, who makes these films precut for various screen sizes.*** UPDATE ***After spending more time using this TV, I noticed a serious problem:  The audio would go out of sync with the video.  Video source is my cable box attached to the TV via HDMI.  After about 10 to 15 minutes, there will be a delay in the audio that will progressively get worse.  Switching the channel and back again will resolve the issue, but only for another 10 to 15 minutes.  While this TV does have a "lip sync" function that allows you to delay the audio, it does not allow any delay in the video thus there is no good way to resolve the issue.  If left on its own, the audio will eventually get a good 3 seconds or more behind the video.  This TV is being returned.The MXH antiglare film from Photodon, while difficult to apply, does work very well.

Reviews.Title: I liked it then I didn't
Reviews.Author: Cotton Socks "Cotton Sox"
Reviews.Content: Arrived here early December 2013. I was really impressed. No dead pixels, nice color, white whites and black blacks. I would have given it 5-stars.Today (4/26/2014) I have moved it to the garage. After just five months, the color saturation and contrast has slowly faded to the point where it is no longer possible to tell between pastel colors of any hue. They all look a slightly murky white with no hint of the intended color.  It is OK when viewing TV-type stuff, but if I cast an app to the TV that has panels of pastel colors, they are all that murky white in one big mushy blob. I am sure it is doing it with the colors for the general TV stuff, but it is not so obvious as the panels on an app.Sadly, there is no option in the on-screen menu to change or adjust colors, contrast, hue or saturation so it is stuck at what it is.I no longer have the packaging to send it back for warranty repairs, but then, I would probably only get a short period of correct colors again so I am cutting my losses and buying a different brand. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: Yvonne S.
Reviews.Content: a great color and a easy set up !!! bought it for guess bed room /// has a great audio sound /// great price you will enjoy it !!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice little HDTV
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: I bought this little TV for my bedroom. My two younger sons use it to watch movies and my wife and I use it to watch TV at night before falling asleep. I was skeptical of buying a television off the internet, but I have been pleasantly surprised. I don't care for anything fancy or big, so this TV was the perfect choice.It took a little while to get used to the sound, as it is different from my older TV, but now it sounds normal. It can also be hooked up to external speakers, which I do from time-to-time. On another TV I had a few years back, you couldn't control the volume with the remote control if you had external speakers plugged in, but you can with this model. I don't know if it was just the TV I had before, or all newer TVs support this now.One thing that bugs me to death about it, is the only button I have found is on the back and it only works the input devices! I have looked all over this thing and cannot find a power button, volume buttons, or channel buttons anywhere. That doesn't mean they aren't there, but if they are, Vizio did a wonderful job hiding them!The picture quality is good. I only have standard cable so I don't what HD cable looks like.The TV stand is a little awkward. It is a curved bar that runs across the bottom from corner to corner and the TV leans back against it; making the TV lean at an angle of about 5-10 degrees. I thought it might would originally affect the picture quality, but it doesn't. My only worry is that my 2-year-old is going to pull it off on himself.Overall, I have been very pleased with my purchase and am considering buying another for my oldest son in the near future.

Reviews.Title: A Great Monitor for My Desktop PC
Reviews.Author: Jon H Weisel
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a similar sized Westinghouse that failed after many years (also a great monitor).  Works really well with my desktop pc.  Would buy it again

Reviews.Title: Number one Amazon and Vizio
Reviews.Author: Leo Oshin
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor ask anyone who has vizio and they will tell you they  are the best. Stick with 1080p led , sweet !! My 22" is like having a 27".

Reviews.Title: Line through the screen
Reviews.Author: SM
Reviews.Content: A yellow line appeared on the screen within a week of normal use. It looks like it is a common problem, would recommend caution if you are considering purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Par383
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a Christmas present for my dad.  I helped get it set up for him, and have to say the picture is great.  Good, clear high def picture.  I'm not a fan of the remotes that come with the VIZIOs, so I had him order a nice universal remote.

Reviews.Title: must buy!
Reviews.Author: Rosa C.
Reviews.Content: awesome i dont have any negative comments for this would definitley recommend to a friend. image and sound quality are very good

Reviews.Title: Great little HDTV
Reviews.Author: Hijumper
Reviews.Content: Great little TV. Bought this for a screened porch and is mounted outside and is exposed to large temperature and humidity variations.So far in the few months I've owned it it works flawlessly.The only complaint I really had was with install. It has a very narrow 100mm x 100mm mounting bolt pattern on the back. This causes mounting brackets to be located very close to each other on the back. Make sure that you use a TV bracket that can be bolted to the rails or else the TV can be wobbly (if mounted).It also doesn't have any Smart TV features or Wifi connectivity so keep that in mind when purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, poor sound
Reviews.Author: Colin Tristan Adams
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to Consumer Reports which reported similar Vizio units as having poor sound.  The picture is really good but the sound is lacking severely.  The only way to fix it is to put external speakers on it.  Thankfully that is easy and solves the issue completely.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Bob B.
Reviews.Content: Loved the slim profile, and the picture and sound quality is great.  We put this in the bedroom of our motorhome and life is great!

Reviews.Title: Nice picture and nice tuner but...
Reviews.Author: EGA
Reviews.Content: Use the TV on the boat and its connected to an HDTV antenna and blue-ray player. The menu and setup is very straightforward. Very nice picture and sound is loud enough (major complain with other brands). Nice little stand and connectors well layout.The only problem is the mounting screws on the back. Go easy while mounting a bracket or it will pop in inside. Still overall very happy and think its probably one of the best value on the market.

Reviews.Title: Great value for basic TV
Reviews.Author: Don Benson
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a spare TV in the basement. I use it to watch TV while working on other things in the basement. Picture is good from all viewing angles, with no noticeable shift in color. The only negative is that I was expecting to be able to plug in a USB stick to watch videos, but the USB connection only supports viewing pictures.For the price and size, it is a great value and a good picture.

Reviews.Title: It's all about the picture
Reviews.Author: Kranki
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV with a full picture from side to side.  Good sound makes it even better.  For the past several years we have become Vizio TV fans.  They have everything we look for in a TV.  Now I really can't wait for the college football season to get here.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture. Great Price
Reviews.Author: J. Hoppe "Hoppe"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to be used in my garage and in my outdoor family room. I have two wall mounted brackets and two Ergatron Quick Release LCD Brackets. This allows my to use one TV in two locations. Simply slide the TV off of one bracket and on to the other. The VIZIO has been great so far. Great picture, nice colors, no dejudder, no motion blur. Images look real just like my Samsung 57" Plasma. Its light and mounting was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Good picture - good value
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid, this is a great value.  It was under $400 delivered and the picture is very good.

Reviews.Title: Decent product
Reviews.Author: G "giddy"
Reviews.Content: For the money I paid, this is decent enough but wanting.  Wish this screen is clearer and more defined.But this is good enough for the time being.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Selena D. Martinez
Reviews.Content: We love this product! It's the perfect size for the bedroom. Very easy to put the stand on and set up! We would recommend this product to anyone who is looking for smaller TV for a bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Solid QAM Tuner, very happy
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Welsh
Reviews.Content: I wanted a TV for my basement bar.  The destiny of this set is casual live TV viewing.  Not "Smart TV", not DVR, no game system...just a basic "hotel room" TV.My #1 priority was a QAM Tuner, which isn't even listed in Amazon's description.  I had to verify it on Vizio's website.
